Woodland.Gable Mansion:
The Gable Mansion is a historic mansion in Woodland, California, listed as a California Historical Landmark, that was built in 1885 for Amos and Harvey Gable, two Yolo County pioneers and ranchers.


== History ==
Located at 659 First Street, the Gable brothers, Amos W. and Harvey C. Gable, had the home designed and built for them by Edward Carlton "Carl" Gilbert, the owner of the Woodland firm "Gilbert & Sons", for the sum of $16,000. The home was designed as a fine example of Victorian architecture.
